p: In a seasonal analysis of polyphenol content between M. villosa and P. amboinicus, statistical difference ( p < 0.05) was found between the two species in every month of the year, except in August, November, and December, as shown in Figure 1. The best month for M. villosa harvest producing the highest total polyphenols content was September (147 mg GAE/g of crude extract). In P. amboinicus case, it was observed that the best month for its harvest was July (164.7 mg GAE/g of crude extract).
